website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills lightweight stick and TIG welder that is designed for hobbies, repairs, and maintenance.
pros: There is a switch on the unit that allows you to easily change between stick welding and TIG welding
The amperage dial allows you to adjust the amperage to fit the job you are performing
Forney offers a 6-month limited warranty on this model
cons: It is important to point out that this unit is ready to go as a stick welder, however additional accessories must be purchased to use it as a TIG welder

customer_reviews.title: I was having a hard time getting an arc on the lower settings but turned up to 90A and was able to have a nice hot bead laid out
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for some repairs around the house, opened the box, set up the machine and started welding 3/32" 7018 rod on some flat bar. I was having a hard time getting an arc on the lower settings but turned up to 90A and was able to have a nice hot bead laid out. The lead and ground clamps are real tight and well made. Overall a good quality product for this price. -NDT Level 3 Welding Inspector
customer_reviews.author: Phantom7

customer_reviews.title: This is one amazing machine, i was really skeptical upon opening it ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to add to my company's service van. This is one amazing machine, i was really skeptical upon opening it and seeing how small and light it is. All i can say is WOW. I welded with it and really put it through its paces today welding over 1/4'' steel with ease. i will say 3/32 rods worked very poorly. I switched to 1/8'' and set it to 65 amp and had no more issues. full penetration with ease. After an hour or so of continuous use the unit was barely warm to the touch. for the price, i doubt you'll find a better portable welder. One happy customer
customer_reviews.author: Ndannen

customer_reviews.title: Foney Arc/tig
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to teach myself welding. So far it has performed great. I have been welding together rail spikes and other scraps of metal I have lying around without any issues on the machines part. I have used: 3/32 6011, 3/32 6013, 1/8 6011, 1/8 6013, and 1/8 7018 rods so far. I haven't used the Tig option yet , due to this not coming with a torch nor do I have any gas for it, but I am glad I have that option for the future. This machine is great for learning, and small jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey

customer_reviews.title: Great little welder
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little welder. Perfect for small jobs. I used it to weld up a grill for my yard and to put some angle iron under my truck for mudflaps. If you aren't doing big jobs, it is perfect. I was surprised how well it worked. For the price, I don't think you can do much better. Great way to learn welding as well. If you are more serious and doing big things, you'll need a more expensive machine. I have always used really big lincoln welders, so I was surprised how much I could do with this little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This welder was great to learn stick welding on - I completed quite a few projects in the first two years of use and was starting to feel confident in my abilities. Unfortunately, after that the machine stopped working and is no longer supported by Forney. It will spark on contact with the project material but will not lay a bead no matter what I do. I've changed the electrode holder AND the ground clamp and both cables but that didn't help. Now I'm in the market for a new welder and it won't be a cheap Forney again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It's pathetic and won't do what you need
customer_reviews.text: It does absolutely nothing except spark around. 6011 and 7018 rods absolutely do not work despite others reviews, it's just not possible. In 1 hr I was able to get a few arcs and make a bead for 2-3 seconds. This was the most frustrating machine I've ever seen. You'd need 1/16 rod or smaller, something I'm just not willing to do because it's just not ever going to weld anything thicker than a few pieces of notebook paper in thickness. My Weller 51 soldering gun would probably do a better job as a welder than this.
customer_reviews.author: Gef

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Welder
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and portable. It seems that 3/32 rods are the best ones for this unit. I tried 1/8 7016 rods and it just didn't quite have enough power. Although I'm not a pro welder. Anyhow, 3/32, 6011 work great and get the job done for repairs and farm use.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: this little welder works awesome! I'm definitely a novice but have welded a little in the past with a lincoln 220 ac dc but for what i"m doing with it now,, I wouldn't buy a 220 welder! I've used it with 6011 3/32 and 6013 3/32 and have had no problems at all! Unless your welding 3/8" and above and not doing contract work of coarse,, Buy it!!! Actually,, I just welded 3/8" to 3/8" with 3/32" rod and could not break it with a 4 lb sledge hammer,, I thought that was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Fabro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Compact Welder!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just for a DIYer home welder for simple home & mobile repairs. Super easy setup & use. Small & lightweight portability. Electrode holder I replaced with a Lincoln Electrode holder due to original was sub par for my uses. It wold work but I didn't like the way the head would move or slide off alignment. So I replaced it. Other than that hickup which is very minor, I love this little cute welder. On the cute scale it's a 10... lol.
customer_reviews.author: K. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for a beginner.  Plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple classes and decided to get something for hoem use, to practice my welding and do some at home repairs and creations. After looking at reviews i decided to give this unit a try and i haven't been disappointed yet. Seems to have no problem doing everything i need. It's lightweight and relatively inexpensive. I'm using it on a dedicated 120v/20 amp circuit and no issues at all. Seems to pack a nice punch
customer_reviews.author: SurfCaster

customer_reviews.title: Beats harbor freight
customer_reviews.text: I had the harbor freight arc welder for years. It cramped out so I thought I’d upgrade. Boot did I! This welder rocks! Seriously, sticks start up 10x faster and welds are 5x better. I can tell the difference in penetration and power consistency. This unit is just as good as any old Lincoln in similar power settings.
customer_reviews.author: Drinnt

customer_reviews.title: Burns the rods
customer_reviews.text: Been welding with this for about 4 months now. Zero problems. I’m impressed with what this can do. It’s not built to burn the 1/8th inch rod but 3/32 all day long.
customer_reviews.author: N-Sight2 Buy

customer_reviews.title: and immediately got a nice pool and was able to get a great bead
customer_reviews.text: I bought an arc welder from another, cheaper vendor that required it be grounded by an electrician. I bought this model, plugged it in, and immediately got a nice pool and was able to get a great bead, and I am recently self-taught at welding and suck! This is an awesome product. I have their MIG wire fed welder and love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: TIGE M. BRAUN

customer_reviews.title: light and powerfull
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a hobby and it works awesome, I made pretty decent lines using 6013 1/16" and 1/8" rods, I haven't use other rods but I will review later using 7018 and 6011. Dutty cycle its ok. It runs pretty smooth, lightweight and easy to use. Haven't used the tig mode I need to buy the torch. If you are looking for a hobby stick welding machine i will recommend this welder.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for small home projects
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with the quality and performance of this welder. I've only been arc welding with a 3/32 6013 rod for now, but it's perfect my small home projects. I was surprised at the small size, but it works great for what I needed it for. Really easy to used and set up. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great little welder.
customer_reviews.text: Great little welder. Super easy to use. My 13 year old son began welding with it this morning and is welding like a pro. Love the size. We are using it to make smokers out of LP tanks with 1/8 inch steel. Works great. I am thinking about buying a second one. Update. We have been using it for about 10 months. My 13 year old son has started a welding business welding, horse shoes, targets, doing repairs for people. It is used a lot. Right now it is getting used 7-10 hours a day. Works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jolicoeur Family

customer_reviews.title: Awesome first welder
customer_reviews.text: The welder is great and easy to use for a rookie. The folks at Forney including Abby were very helpful. Her videos taught me everything I needed to know and her live help to better understand polarity was a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Travascio

customer_reviews.title: Basis lightweight portable welder.
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet had occasion to use the 100ST very much so far, but it seems to work better than I expected for such a small, light-weight welder. It seems to work reasonably well on 120VAC, even when power must be supplied by an extension. Welding with it requires patience and care, but reasonably good welds can be achieved. It seems especially good for occasional weld repairs on light gauge metal. I have not yet used it for any continuous welding, but have not noticed any overheating or nuisance tripping of breakers so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little welder for small projects. Using 3/32 7018 and it’s not super easy to get started but once it does, it runs quite well. I’m a welder by profession so I actually know what a puddle is supposed to do and look like.
customer_reviews.author: James Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Nice Welder
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little rig. Well made and the handle holds the cables, nice touch. Burns a 3/32 E6011 real nice at 60A. Starts Great and has a real nice ground clamp and 200A well made rod holder. It has an internal fan and 6' leads.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: my issue rather than the welder
customer_reviews.text: works well, but I think the problem is more my issue rather than the welder. My experience may not be adequate to operate this effectively.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Opened it, assembled it, plugged it in... No Arc. Went through all the troubleshooting before I pulled out the multimeter... Less than an amp DC current coming directly from the lead attachment ports at max. Bad out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: K. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I received my machine yesterday and had a little job to do on my mower deck. I haven't struck an arc in over 20 years, took this out of the box, set it up and took care of my job. I was using 3/32 6013 rod at 90 amps, it surprised me at how easily it struck the arc and how easy it was to run the bead. My opinion you can't beat it for the money. Yes I do recommend this welder for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Perkin

customer_reviews.title: but for around the house stuff it has worked great. I feel pretty confident this will work for ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a trained welder and this is my first one, but for around the house stuff it has worked great. I feel pretty confident this will work for those needs for years to come. If it breaks down at some point I will update. Easy to use and setup. Easy to pick up and take with you. It's a shame all the crap I've thrown out that I could now fix. Super glue for metal.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Weld with Forney
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased a different brand welder that worked maybe a year. This came and is identical in shape, size and weight but at a better price for the value. So far it has worked great!
customer_reviews.author: M5H2K

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the aspiring welder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this welder to teach myself how to weld with a stick welder. I am already proficient in MIG welding, so this isn't the first welder I've owned. While I've owned cheap MIG's in the past, they were always pieces of junk. This product however is a beautifully built high quality machine at a really low price point. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a great entry level stick welder.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous56

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: welding things up all over the place. love this thing. i suggest getting an auto darkening mask. never used one of these before and it is a game changer. did not know what i was missing
customer_reviews.author: baked

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Machine
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this Welder. I ordered this Machine based on it's good product reviews. Yes there are a few negative reviews on this Machine but also there are a lot of negative people period. Most Shop Hand welders will complain about anything. If you like to get a simple Weld Job done easy, quick and have fun building things, this is the Machine. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this wilder. Does everything I need it to (make metal stick together). Dont go building bridges, but this is a good capable machine. Looking to get the tig add on soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Welder
customer_reviews.text: Solid stick welder, I am not a professional welder. This is a great welder for the price. My mig welder was just not doing a good weld for thicker steel, this welder does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, hooked it up and boom!, welding. For such an inexpensive machine it welds very well. Easily has enough power to weld up to 1/4”. Taught my son to weld with it over the weekend. It strikes and starts very easily.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am a fence contractor and use this to make my own residential gates. Welds 1 3/8 galvanized pipe no problem. Was very surprised when I plugged this in to my 20 amp outlet in my garage and it worked great without ever tripping the breaker. Hoping it welds the 1 5/8 schedule 40 pipe just as well 👍. Already paid for itself. Very happy customer
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.

customer_reviews.title: but the high setting has resulted in good welds.
customer_reviews.text: The first unit received had an issue very early on. A simple phone call (not the hours long wait that you'd expect from many companies) and they had a new unit on our doorstep in just a few days. That was unexpected and appreciated. It welds quite well, especially considering the cost. The lower Amp settings have been of no use, but the high setting has resulted in good welds.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Retired after27yrs welding. Perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Welded very well. Straight outta box. Already to upgrade to bigger welder, be a while. Forbes has a good product here
customer_reviews.author: Mike massie

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical with this. I welded on Great Lakes Ships for a few years, burned rod after rod day after day. I did not have high hopes. Opened the box, everything looked good. Hooked it up, and it laid bead very, very well. So far I've only used 6013 rod, I have yet to use any 70-, but again, it worked very well!
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome welder.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic welder for home and light use. I've even used it to cut a bolt (bed bolt) off. I would buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: GREAT ITEM. I am not a professional at all but this unit was perfect for a beginner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little welder works great great price I remember growing ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little welder works great great price I remember growing up my dad had a Forney Welder in our auto repair garage.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Great welder
customer_reviews.text: This welder works very well for most general maintenance and fabrication projects.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. David J. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Very good for a small machine I just dont give 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good for a small machine I just dont give 5 stars becouse say tig but how if dont have where to connect the gas ..
customer_reviews.author: Jose Simas

customer_reviews.title: Great compact welder
customer_reviews.text: This welder is great! Easy setup, and easy to use. I really like how compact it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Monk

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done.
customer_reviews.text: It took a little time to dial in the amperage setting, but I was able to make a box out of 24 gauge steel. Nice little welder for the money. I had no issues with the duty cycle and the unit overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: 1/8 in. Rods are hard to strike and hold ...
customer_reviews.text: 1/8 in. Rods are hard to strike and hold arc, and I have been welding over 55 years and was certified in college 1969.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Hall, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Worth its value
customer_reviews.text: It is a simple welder but does a good job. I've welded a few pieces trying it out it works good.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: great little welder
customer_reviews.text: great little welder, just be sure you are not on a gfci circuit, and not using an extension cord too long.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son he love's it works like an expensive one and was great for the price
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Small and convenient, but great quality. I'm amazed at how well it works!
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Burn, baby, burn
customer_reviews.text: I weld as part of my living working as a refractory bricklayer. This little baby can lay down some beads. Most home projects - this is perfect for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rigoberto Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Can weld real nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like this welder small and does the job..this welder will not pop out braker..
customer_reviews.author: J.cald

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone looking for a small home welder.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, came with everything it said, and papers were included. Iv used it for just practicing and also some smaller home projects.
customer_reviews.author: William R Drislane

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little welder. I used it to build a coal forge for getting started in blacksmithing. I dont see using this for heavy duty use, however if used like its meant to for hobby and basic type stuff around the shop and home ITS PERFECT!!!!!! Well worth the money. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: david welborn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. Using it with 6011 rods.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not at the moment
customer_reviews.text: The product former Easy welder I bought from you no longer working properly. I want to return it back to you, send me return label for replacement or my refund. Take care,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money & time.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice little welder to run off of 120v. Burns rods in real good and good penetration. Be nice if the leads were a little long.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Super light . But use there rods they weld great I used the 6011
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barone

customer_reviews.title: Toataly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great little welder. As a novice welder I use it to practice welding. Easy to setup and take down. Does a great job on most of my projects.
customer_reviews.author: David L Clapp

customer_reviews.title: pretty dandy
customer_reviews.text: lightweight and reliable much better than those simder crap welders
customer_reviews.author: kreea

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This little box is worth the money. It welds very good. I love the portability of it
customer_reviews.author: mark p

customer_reviews.title: Great welder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Welded subframe connectors under our convertible, 3/32 6013 rods @ 55-60A, Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Welds holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat it for the money. I’m not a certified welder, but with a little research and videos I was able to fix my rototiller and linkage on my 3 point hitch on my tractor. Welds holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: All in all a pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: For a small welder it works fairly well,compact lightweight,I use it on farm and lawn equipment repairs
customer_reviews.author: Michael ray

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It was my first using welding machine, just little a bit confuse for using welding stick but the product is good. I can not complain about that!
customer_reviews.author: Cart & Supply

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband he works on lawnmowers and snowblowers he loves it he would highly recommend it It’s great if you have a small shop
customer_reviews.author: Helen Budka

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great did some light frame repair on an old Toyota pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish that the cables were longer, but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish that the cables were longer, but the price was right. It's almost impossible to sustain an arc at less than 45 amps.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P.

customer_reviews.title: Great welds, maintains an arc
customer_reviews.text: First product I've ever felt compelled to write a review for it. Great welds, maintains an arc. For a 110v welder this thing is awesome!!! Easily fabricated a little welding cart for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: All I have to say is WOW ! ! ! Definitely worth the price I payed. I have way went beyond what the specifications rate as a duty cycle and it continues to run like a champ. This rig runs any 3/32 all day long. Hope you buy it, you cannot beat this price and capability. Feels cheap but is a BOSS!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine little welder
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well exactly what I hoped it would be. Good for beginners like me.
customer_reviews.author: Jonson

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I've welded 3/32 6013 rod and 1/8 7018 with it and it's cranked out some nice welds it's a little more difficult to get the 7018 started but it's very doable and once you get the 7018 going it runs great
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The weld works just like it says it will. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: WreckEm

customer_reviews.title: Great Welder
customer_reviews.text: Works like a big welder!! It only needs 110 volts
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Only 120V
customer_reviews.text: Works great does what is said it could easy to carry
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Tried out some hobart 1/8 6013 and it burns like no tomorrow with great penetration on 20ga steel
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly impressed with this rig. Tried out some hobart 1/8 6013 and it burns like no tomorrow with great penetration on 20ga steel. So a welder of this price point and this size having the ability to handle 1/8 electrodes is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Steven. G

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little welder. It worked great for 7 1/2 months and now has failed working.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and easy to use. Great for a low amp welder. If your looking for compact and portable and don't need to weld thick steel look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Katie w

customer_reviews.title: Extremely limited
customer_reviews.text: Not really useful for anything except 6013 in my experience. 6011 is almost impossible due to the need to maintain a super short arc length to accomplish anything. By short i mean near direct contact with the work. The amount of money I've blown trying to find rods that work with this box has eclipsed any money saved by its low price. If I could return it I would in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Edmonson

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this little welder for small projects
customer_reviews.text: went to move my trailer this morning and noticed the axle welds had broken off.. turned this little welder on and used a 1/8 rod 7018 and it fixed it up perfectly at 70 amps. I highly recommend this little welder for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Tommyboy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Very light material type of unit, E7018 rods were hard to get going I have purchased some different rods and expect it will be better.
customer_reviews.author: steve fox

customer_reviews.title: Great little welder
customer_reviews.text: Great little welder. Works fine for me welding steel up to 3/8" thick. Good penetration and leaves a nice clean bead. Of course I know how to weld.
customer_reviews.author: aaron r parsons

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for small fencing and repairs around my property and I was very disappointed. I couldn't weld even weld 1/8" steel. I have used several 110volt welders before and they all outperformed this unit. I will be returning this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have never welded with a small 110v machine but this one is really impressive.
customer_reviews.author: C L Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Works kind of
customer_reviews.text: OK I actually bought and used this ran for all of 5 seconds. Arc started then the breaker would trip right after that was on a 20amp gfi outlet for what ever that is worth. My other 120v welder has no issues
customer_reviews.author: a o

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: China junk. Don't know why a US company would put their name on them.
customer_reviews.author: Russ T.

product_meta.title: Forney Easy Weld 298 Arc Welder 100ST, 120-Volt, 90-Amp,Green
product_meta.description: 100ST Stick Welder features an innovative, inverter power system that is lightweight and simple to use ensuring hassle-free operation and top performance results. The perfect starter arc welder machine delivers a 120V input and 90A output plus is TIG capable, sold separately. Efficiently designed to handle up to 1/8” electrode and welds 16 gauge up to 5/16”. Great for dome automotive applications and projects around the home.
feature_bullets: Click on the (BY FORNEY) name above in blue under the title to view our full catalog of Welders, Abrasives, Chain/Wire Rope, Tools and more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars197 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
